summary: The Finding Opportunities for Resource Exploration Act (S. 1463) aims to allow the Secretary of the Interior to establish memoranda of understanding (MOUs) with foreign countries to cooperatively map critical minerals and rare earth elements. The bill focuses on increasing the security and resilience of international supply chains for these resources. It outlines objectives for the MOUs, including offering rights of first refusal to U.S. and allied companies, facilitating private investment, and protecting mapping data. The Secretary of State and private sector actors will be consulted on this.
